焼きトン: (やきトン) - yakiton; grilled pork on skewers
焼きドーナツ: (やきドーナツ) - baked donut (as opposed to deep-fried)
焼き上がる: (やきあがる) - to be baked (food); to be printed (photos); to be fired (pottery)
焼き上げる: (やきあげる) - to burn; to roast; to grill; to bake
焼き付き: (やきつき) - burn-in (e.g. CRT display)/ghosting; seizing (e.g. bearing)
焼き付く: (やきつく) - to be scorched into/to be seared into; to make a strong impression/to be etched in (one's memory)
焼き付ける: (やきつける) - to bake; to plate; to print; to burn or bake into; to burn into one's memory
焼き印: (やきいん) - brand (burnt-in mark of identification); branding iron
焼き印を押す: (やきいんをおす) - to brand (cattle, etc.)
焼き型: (やきがた) - mold (e.g. cake mold); mould; baking pan; bread pan
焼き場: (やきば) - crematory; place where things are burned
焼き塩: (やきしお) - roasted salt; parched salt; baked salt
焼き尽くす: (やきつくす) - to thoroughly burn; to burn to nothing
焼き尽す: (やきつくす) - to thoroughly burn; to burn to nothing
焼き打ち: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼き払う: (やきはらう) - to burn down (to the ground); to clear away by burning; to reduce to ashes; to burn off
焼き接ぎ: (やきつぎ) - assimilating broken ceramics via baking
焼き殺す: (やきころす) - to kill by burning to death
焼き海苔: (やきのり) - baked seaweed; toasted seaweed
焼き物: (やきもの) - earthenware/pottery/porcelain/china; flame-broiled food (esp. fish); tempered blade
焼き玉機関: (やきだまきかん) - hot-bulb or semi-diesel engine
焼き畑: (やきばたけ) - swidden; land made arable by slash-and-burn agriculture
焼き直す: (やきなおす) - to grill again; to rehash
焼き立て: (やきたて) - fresh made; freshly baked; freshly roasted
焼き立ての魚: (やきたてのさかな) - fish hot from the oven
焼き筆: (やきふで) - wooden stick with a burned tip (used to create underdrawings)
焼き米: (やきごめ) - roasted or parched rice
焼き肉: (やきにく) - yakiniku/Japanese dish of grilled meat similar to Korean barbecue; roasted meat/grill
焼き蕎麦: (やきそば) - yakisoba (similar to chow mein); fried noodles, usu. with with vegetables and meat
焼き蛤: (やきはまぐり) - grilled clam; baked clam
焼き討ち: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼き豚: (やきぶた) - roast pork; baseball fan
焼き鍋: (やきなべ) - cooking pot (for roasting, broiling, etc.)
焼き鏝: (やきごて) - soldering iron/hot iron; brand/mark/stigma
焼き餅: (やきもち) - jealousy; roasted rice cake
焼き餠: (やきもち) - jealousy; roasted rice cake
焼き鳥: (やきとり) - yakitori; chicken pieces (or sometimes beef or pork offal) grilled on a skewer
焼き麩: (やきふ) - yakifu; light, bread-like dish made from baked wheat gluten
焼く: (yaku) - to burn; to roast, to broil, to grill, to bake, to toast, to barbecue , to burn; to roast, to broil, to grill, to bake, to toast, to barbecue; to heat, to heat up; to make (carvão, cerâmica, tijolos, etc.), to bake, to fire, to burn
焼けただれる: (やけただれる) - to be hideously burned
焼けぼっくい: (やけぼっくい) - charred stake; ember
焼ける: (やける) - (焼ける only) to burn/to be roasted/to be heated/to be sunburnt/to fade (in the sun)/to glow red (i.e. of the sky at sunset); to be jealous/to be envious
焼けを起こす: (やけをおこす) - to become desperate; to give way to despair
焼け出される: (やけだされる) - to be burned out (of one's home)
焼け太り: (やけぶとり) - prospering after a fire
焼け失せる: (やけうせる) - to burn up completely
焼け山: (やけやま) - burnt mountain; dormant volcano
焼け棒杭: (やけぼっくい) - charred stake; ember
焼け棒杭に火が付く: (やけぼっくいにひがつく) - Wood half-burned is easily kindled
焼け死ぬ: (やけしぬ) - to be burnt to death
焼け残る: (やけのこる) - to escape being burned (esp. of a building or the items in it); to survive a fire
焼け火ばし: (やけひばし) - burning-hot tongs; red-hot tongs
焼け火箸: (やけひばし) - burning-hot tongs; red-hot tongs
焼け爛れる: (やけただれる) - to be hideously burned
焼け石: (やけいし) - hot or heated stone
焼け石に水: (やけいしにみず) - something bound to fail due to inadequate effort, assistance, etc.; pouring water on a hot stone
焼け落ちる: (やけおちる) - to be burned down
焼け跡: (やけあと) - ruins of a fire; fire-devastated area
焼け酒: (やけざけ) - drowning one's cares in drink; drinking in desperation
焼け野の雉夜の鶴: (やけののきぎすよるのつる) - parents may risk life and limb for their children (like a pheasant when the plains are burning or a crane on a cold night)
焼け野の鴉: (やけののからす) - (something originally dark in color appearing even darker) blacker than black
焼け野原: (やけのはら) - burnt field; burnt area
焼そば: (やきそば) - yakisoba (similar to chow mein); fried noodles, usu. with with vegetables and meat
